View, copy, and regenerate storage access keys

MarkdownBlockBase.code_block: # create a context for account and key $ctx=New-AzureStorageContext storage-account-name storage-account-key
# create a new share $s = New-AzureStorageShare logs -Context $ctx

LinkItem.internal_link_text: Naming and Referencing Shares, Directories, Files, and Metadata
Naming and Referencing Shares, Directories, Files, and Metadata

MarkdownBlockBase.code_block: # create a directory in the share New-AzureStorageDirectory -Share $s -Path CustomLogs
# upload a local file to the new directory Set-AzureStorageFileContent -Share $s -Source C:\temp\Log1.txt -Path CustomLogs
# list files in the new directory Get-AzureStorageFile -Share $s -Path CustomLogs

# copy a file to the new directory Start-AzureStorageFileCopy -SrcShareName srcshare -SrcFilePath srcdir/hello.txt -DestShareName destshare -DestFilePath destdir/hellocopy.txt -Context $srcCtx -DestContext $destCtx # copy a blob to a file directory Start-AzureStorageFileCopy -SrcContainerName srcctn -SrcBlobName hello2.txt -DestShareName hello -DestFilePath hellodir/hello2copy.txt -DestContext $ctx -Context $ctx

LinkItem.internal_link_text: Create a virtual machine running Windows Server
Create a virtual machine running Windows Server
How to log on to a virtual machine running Windows Server
How to log on to a virtual machine running Windows Server

MarkdownBlockBase.code_block:
net use <drive-letter>: \\<storage-account-name>.file.core.windows.net\<share-name>
example : net use z: \\samples.file.core.windows.net\logs

net use <drive-letter>: \\<storage-account-name>.file.core.windows.net\<share-name> /u:<storage-account-name> <storage-account-key>
example : net use z: \\samples.file.core.windows.net\logs /u:samples <storage-account-key>
